page.title: 12MOVERONS/ARABLE & LIVESTOCK
page.content: A three year crop rotation on the gravel,and a two year rotation on the marshy areas is used. The grain is stored in eighteen silos in three large barns,each silo holding 40 tonnes.Much of the grain is sold to a company in Ardleigh.In the past the silos had to be shovelled by hand,but now the grain is scked out by a large vacuum machine.The farm owns three tractors,one combine harvester,one fertiliser spray,one seed drill,and one plough.Consequently only three men work it,whereas in 1950 it would have needed at least eleven. Until recently 123 cattle were reared on grassland,on reclaimed gravel pits. The newly bought calves,were fattened for two years for beef. Now only a few chickens,ducks and dogs are kept on the farm.
